description: From Latin corroborans, present participle. See corroborate.

adjectives.description: corroborant (comparative more corroborant, superlative most corroborant)

entries.meaning: Anything that gives strength or support; a tonic.
examples: The sensible qualities of argentina promise no great virtue of this kind; for to the taste it discovers only a slight roughishness, from whence it may be presumed to be entitled to a place only among the milder corroborants.

As a scrupulous and faithful antiquary, Morales was accustomed to require evidence, and to investigate it; and for these he could find no other testimony than tradition and antiquity, which, as presumptive proofs, were strong corroborants of faith, but did not suffice of themselves.
